result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer P Graf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Huber release and good time granted. 60 days to report.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Concurrent to Ct. 1. Huber release and good time granted.
Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay and DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spencer P Graf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Spencer P Graf in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 2 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 as charged and amended Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Ct. 1 and amended Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
from ADA Korb requesting court to put 13-CF-088 on the calendar the same day as 16-CF-35 as Defense is accepting the State's offer.
Defense waives reading of Information and stands mute, asks court to enter not guilty pleas on defendants behalf.  Court enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bond remains as is.

Defendant Spencer P Graf in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Rick Brian Meier in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that Defendant is in middle of medical crisis, requests rescheduling, will be waiving prelim at that time.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Spencer P Graf in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
